title: Server (FunctionBlock)
text:
FUNCTION_BLOCK ABSTRACT Server
MODBUS server (slave) base class.
Supported function codes
Â¶
Supported function codes can be configured, see fcsSupported.
By default the MODBUS server supports:
ReadCoils
ReadDiscreteInputs
ReadHoldingRegisters
ReadInputRegisters
WriteSingleCoil
WriteSingleRegister
WriteMultipleRegisters
ReadWriteMultipleRegisters
Optionally it supports also:
MaskWriteRegister
âdata modelâ
Â¶
The âdata modelâ allows:
non-consecutive index for the âdata itemsâ (for example: index 0..9, 20..29)
multiple (non-consecutive) memory blocks for âdata itemsâ in one âdata blockâ (for example: index 0..9 => memory block 1, index 20..29 => memory block 2)
not-memory-mapped âdata itemsâ (user code needs to be written to handle reads/writes for those âdata itemsâ)
âdiscrete inputsâ / âcoilsâ : data item size 1 bit or 8 bit (basically: ARRAY [0..numBits/8] OF BYTE vs. ARRAY [0..numBits-1] OF BOOL)
âinput registersâ / âholding registersâ : data item size of 16 bit (basically: ARRAY [0..numRegisters-1] OF UDINT)
overlapping memory blocks, could overlap âregistersâ with âregistersâ as well as âregistersâ with âdiscrete inputsâ / âcoilsâ (caution - hard to use feature)
To support all this the âdata modelâ (
TableDefinitions
) defines zero or more
TableSection
for each of the MODBUS âprimary tablesâ (
TableDefinition
).
Some more or less obvious limitations:
all âdata itemsâ in one section need to have the same TableSection.uiDataItemSize
all âdata itemâ index in one âprimary tableâ have to be unique, so no section index overlap is allowed of course
read/write requests must not span more than one section
âdata itemâ offset / âdata itemâ numbers
Â¶
Please note: unlike standard MODBUS, in CODESYS MODBUS the âdata itemâ numbers are equal to the âdata addressesâ.
The MODBUS standard states: âIn the MODBUS data Model each element within a data block is numbered from 1 to n.â
In CODESYS MODBUS the âdata itemsâ are numbered from 0 to n-1.
